oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Chuck Wagon Gang Interview - Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Chuck Wagon Gang (performance group) conducted by Biff Collie.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Chuck Wagon Gang; Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Biff Collie introduces the Chuck Wagon Gang as "Keep On The Sunny Side" (Chuck Wagon Gang) plays -- (00:41) We Are Climbing (Chuck Wagon Gang) -- (02:57) Collie introduces the Chuck Wagon Gang, himself, and commercial sponsor (West Texas Chevrolet Dealership) -- (03:14) Collie asks the Chuck Wagon Gang to tell their story -- (03:21) Roy Carter and Anna (Fie) Carter Gordon Davis tell about how Davis fell on their first performance and how Carter caught Davis -- (04:23) Collie asks to hear "Leyland Way" -- (04:32) Leyland Way (Chuck Wagon Gang) -- (06:46) Collie talks about the track "Echoes From the Burning Bush" and Pat McKee jokes about having great difficulty waking up -- (07:41) Echoes From the Burning Bush (Chuck Wagon Gang) -- (09:56) Collie compliments the group, Betty Godwin jokes, and Collie introduces the commercial sponsor (West Texas Chevrolet Dealership) -- (10:24) Collie gives the address to write to the Chuck Wagon Gang -- (10:43) Collie tells Carter about a letter and Carter introduces McKee to play "Church in the Wildwood" (11:13) Church in the Wildwood (Chuck Wagon Gang) -- ( 13:04) Collie gives an outre, saying goodbye, as the Chuck Wagon Gang plays a melody in the background [unidentified]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Chuck Wagon Gang; Collie, Biff;
